tool.name: DEMCreator

param.name: LAS Input Directory
param.dialogReference: The directory where the input LiDAR LAS tiles are found.

param.name: Output Raster Directory
param.dialogReference: The directory in which the output raster will be placed.

param.name: Output Coordinate System
param.dialogReference: The coordinate system of the original DEM tiles. This needs to be in a projected coordinate system and not a spheroidal coordinate system.

param.name: Cell Assignment Type
param.dialogReference:
Cell Assignment Type is used to determine each output cell using the points that fall within its extent.

AVERAGE—Assigns the average value of all points in the cell. This is the default.

MINIMUM—Assigns the minimum value found in the points within the cell.

MAXIMUM—Assigns the maximum value found in the points within the cell.

IDW—Uses Inverse Distance Weighted interpolation to determine the cell value.

NEAREST—Uses Nearest Neighbor assignment to determine the cell value.

param.name: Void Fill Method
param.dialogReference:
Void Fill Method is used to determine the value of cells that do not contain any LAS points.

NONE—NoData is assigned to the cell.

SIMPLE—Averages the values from data cells immediately surrounding a NoData cell to eliminate small voids.

LINEAR—Triangulates across void areas and uses linear interpolation on the triangulated value to determine the cell value. This is the default.

NATURAL_NEIGHBOR—Uses natural neighbor interpolation to determine the cell value.

param.name: Output Data Type
param.dialogReference:
The output raster type of the DEM/DSM. There are two options -

- FLOAT , the ouput will be floating point which will preserve the original elevation values.

- INT, the output will be integer and truncate the original elevation value to nearest integer, but will create a smaller size file.

param.name: Cell Size
param.dialogReference: The size of the output cell in projection distance units.

param.name: Z Factor
param.dialogReference: The factor by which Z values will be multiplied. This is typically used to convert Z linear units to match XY linear units. The default is 1, which leaves elevation values unchanged.

tool.summary: If there are not laready existing DEM/DSM tiles, this tool will create them from the LIDAR LAS tiles.

dataIdInfo.idCredit: The development of this tool was funded through a contract awarded by the Transportation Consortium of South-Central States (Tran-SET) - a consortium supported by USDoT.
dataIdInfo.idAbs: If there are not laready existing DEM/DSM tiles, this tool will create them from the LIDAR LAS tiles.
